name: Immortal Lines From Classic TV Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Ed Norton.

	Norton explains to Ralph what is meant by the golfing term: 'address the ball...'

Lou Grant.

	Lou to Mary Richards on her job interview.

questions.text: 'Will you buy me a bottle of wine?' 'No. But, I'll give you a dollar.' 'Good. Then I can buy two bottles of wine.'
questions.explanation:
Rhoda.

	Rhoda and Carlton, the doorman.

questions.text: 'Change.' 'Not for you or any man.' 'Change. Nickels, dimes, quarters.'
questions.explanation:
Cheers.

	Sam and Diane at the bar.

questions.text: 'There's a man crawling under your bed.' 'He's looking for an outlet.' 'Has he tried basket weaving?'
questions.explanation:
Odd Couple.

	Myrna and Oscar in Oscar's bedroom.

questions.text: 'I hate to see you cry like this.' 'It's the only way I know how to cry.'
questions.explanation:
Dick Van Dyke.

	Rob and Laura.

questions.text: 'There but for the grace of God goes my dog.'
'Why didn't you use a name like John Wayne or Richard Nixon?' 'It's easier to remember when you use a real person.'
questions.explanation:
Three's Company.

	Jack and Larry (about Larry's use of Jack's name.)

questions.text: 'Maybe he doesn't put up as many shelves as he used to...'
questions.explanation:
Mr. Roper

	Mr. Roper to Jack, describing his 'slowing down' in the romance department.

questions.text: 'A wondrous land whose boundaries are that of imagination.'
questions.explanation:
Rod Serling.

	The opening to the 'Twilight Zone'.
